pr_title: [#1089] Scan both methods and fields for IDs and Aggregate Member annotations

timeline.message: Add support to use and annotate methods for IDs and Aggregate versions
Add support for AggregateMember annotation on methods
Merge branch 'master' into feature/1089-annotated-methods-and-fields
Add tests for AggregateMember annotation on methods and verify event forwarding
Merge branch 'master' into feature/1089-annotated-methods-and-fields
Add missing JavaDoc
Refactor and add more tests for ReflectionUtils
Move Distinct list to it's own Utils class
Merge branch 'master' into feature/1089-annotated-methods-and-fields
Adjust Javadoc
Delegate deprecated Field only method to new universal implementation
Extract exception message to a single field

timeline.bodyText: I'd add something to this exception stating that no parameters are expected for an aggregate's annotated methods. Should be careful with the wording though, as a command handler is also an annotated method of an aggregate of course 😅
timeline.author: smcvb

replies.bodyText:
Aggregate [%s] has an annotated value providing method [%s] with parameters maybe?
That would also be applicable to Aggregate [%s] has an annotated value providing method [%s] with void return type, but a return value is required
replies.author: sandjelkovic

replies.bodyText: Message in the exception has been adjusted to be slightly more specific.
replies.author: smcvb

timeline.bodyText:
Somewhat of a bummer, but this isn't backwards compatible. Than again, chances are slim users have implemented this themselves...let's discuss whether we should go forward with this or deprecate the Field methods and add a Member method.
The latter would introduce a similar change as you did for the AbstractChildEntityDefinition#isFieldTypeSupported(Field), on all the methods where Field has been replaced by Member.
timeline.author: smcvb
timeline.diffHunk:

     /**
      * Initializes an instance of a {@link ForwardingMode}.
      *
-     * @param field       The {@link java.lang.reflect.Field} to apply a ForwardingMode on. Provided to be able to check
+     * @param member      The {@link java.lang.reflect.Member} to apply a ForwardingMode on. Provided to be able to check
      *                    for annotations attributes which might assist in the forwarding process.
      * @param childEntity A {@link EntityModel} constructed from the
      *                    given {@code field}.
      */
-    default void initialize(Field field, EntityModel childEntity) {
+    default void initialize(Member member, EntityModel childEntity) {

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -72,31 +76,41 @@
      *
      * @param field a {@link java.lang.reflect.Field} containing a Child Entity
      * @return true if the type is as required by the implementation and false if it is not
+     * @deprecated
      */
+    @Deprecated
     protected abstract boolean isFieldTypeSupported(Field field);
 
+    /**
+     * Check whether the given {@link java.lang.reflect.Member} is of a type supported by this definition.
+     *
+     * @param member a {@link java.lang.reflect.Member} containing or returning a Child Entity
+     * @return true if the type is as required by the implementation and false if it is not
+     */
+    protected abstract boolean isMemberTypeSupported(Member member);
+
     /**
      * Extracts the Child Entity contained in the given {@code declaringEntity} as an {@link EntityModel}.
      * The type of the Child Entity is defined through a key in the provided {@code attributes} or based on given
      * {@link java.lang.reflect.Field}.
      *
      * @param declaringEntity the {@link EntityModel} declaring the given {@code field}
      * @param attributes      a {@link java.util.Map} containing the {@link AggregateMember} attributes
-     * @param field           the {@link java.lang.reflect.Field} containing the Child Entity.
+     * @param member          the {@link java.lang.reflect.Member} containing the Child Entity.
      * @param <T>             the type {@code T} of the given {@code declaringEntity} {@link EntityModel}
      * @return the Child Entity contained in the {@code declaringEntity}
      */
     protected abstract <T> EntityModel<Object> extractChildEntityModel(EntityModel<T> declaringEntity,
                                                                        Map<String, Object> attributes,
-                                                                       Field field);

timeline.bodyText: When matching the models' routing key with the routing key in the @CommandHandler, it is expected to be identical to the property name in the command. So, not the method name, as is being validated here. As such, we should remove any get prepending the routing key if it comes from a method.
timeline.author: smcvb

timeline.bodyText: This scenario would be a valid use case where the routingKey should be set on the @EntityId/@AggregateIdentifier. Would be smart to be specific about this in the javadoc too.
timeline.author: smcvb

replies.bodyText: Javadoc for the @EntityId and @AggregateIdentifier has been adjusted to clarify this.
replies.author: smcvb

timeline.bodyText: This case, when users only provide an @Id field, is obviously rather problematic on a method. Not sure we can do anything about this...
timeline.author: smcvb

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't GetterTypedIdentifierAggregate be used for this test instead of TypedIdentifierAggregate?
timeline.author: smcvb

timeline.message: Review remarks and improvements
Improvements based on review
Merge branch 'master' into feature/1089-annotated-methods-and-fields
Strip Getter names to mimic fields for routing keys

Update messaging/src/main/java/org/axonframework/common/ListUtils.java

Co-authored-by: Steven van Beelen <steven.vanbeelen@axoniq.io>
Merge branch 'master' into feature/1089-annotated-methods-and-fields

Minor indentation and javadoc adjustments

Perform some minute changes when it comes to indentation and javadoc, as
 well as the removal of unused code and unnecessary warnings

#1089

Javadoc adjustments

Perform several javadoc adjustments to clarify the intent of the
method/class, or to simply clean up the documentation.

#1089

Include method target

Include this annotation to be allowed on methods

#1089

Simple renames and indentation changes

Simple renames and indentation changes

#1089

Fine tune overall inspectFieldsAndMethods process

- Add static import for AnnotationUtils.findAnnotationAttributes
- Rename "type" to "handlerType" to be more specific
- Adjust indentation for readability
- Add some comments, whenever applicable, for clarification
- Reorder methods to follow regular invoke ordering
- Add annotation name to assertValidValueProvidingMethod() method to
improve exception message
- Add javadoc to private getMemberIdentifierName to clarify intent

- Adjust setVersionMember to validate if more than one is provided and
if so, throw an exception
- Add logger to note version member settings
- Add tests to validate aggregate version member logic
- Use tertiary operators

#1089

Fix sonarqube issues

- Add some missing deprecation javadoc
- Adjust complexity of some tests

#1089
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into feature/1089-annotated-methods-and-fields

timeline.bodyText: Why not remove abstract from this method and invoke isMemberTypeSupported. Having it this way, you could remove "dummy" impls from children of this class.
timeline.author: m1l4n54v1c

timeline.message:
Replace abstract deprecated method for implementation

By implementing the isFieldTypeSupported(Field) method, we can remove
the deprecated implementations on the implementations of the
AbstractChildEntityDefinition, thus cleaning up more in one go.

#1089
